mnemonic: TEMPO = TEM-po - like TEMPO (time) and weather!
grammar_notes: Context determines weather or time. Masculine.
cultural_note: 'Como está o tempo?' is classic conversation starter in Portugal!

mnemonic: FAZ SOL = it MAKES sun - Portuguese weather verbs!
cultural_note: Portugal has 300+ sunny days per year - 'faz sol' is common!

mnemonic: ESTÁ A CHOVER = is SHOWERING down rain!
cultural_note: 'Chove' a lot in winter in Northern Portugal and Azores!

mnemonic: FAZ FRIO = it makes FREEZE-o cold!
cultural_note: Portuguese houses often lack central heating - 'faz frio' indoors too!
Summer in Portugal can reach 40°C - 'faz muito calor'!

mnemonic: ESTÁ NUBLADO = clouds are like a NUBE (veil)!
cultural_note: Cloudy days common in Lisbon winter - but mild temperature!

mnemonic: HÁ VENTO = there IS wind - VENTilation!
cultural_note: Portugal's coast is windy - great for surfing and wind energy!
Snow in Serra da Estrela - Portugal's only ski resort!

mnemonic: SOL = SOLE source of light - the sun!
cultural_note: Portuguese love sunbathing - 'apanhar sol' (catch sun) is national hobby!

mnemonic: CHUVA = SHOO-va - rain goes SHOO away!
example1_pt: A chuva é boa para as plantas.

cultural_note: Portugal uses Celsius - '20 graus' is a nice day!
'Está a 25 graus' - that's a perfect Portuguese day!
